block.p: Would a chief executive really raise the rent on his own mother by more than $1,500 a month? Jonathan M. Tisch, the co-chairman of the Loews Corporation, who runs its Loews Hotels unit, may have no choice.

His mother, Joan Tisch, lives in an apartment in the Loews Regency Hotel on Park Avenue in Manhattan, which she rents for $55,000 a month. (She also rents an additional hotel room for $4,200 a month.)

Would a chief executive really raise the rent on his own mother by more than $1,500 a month? Jonathan M. Tisch, the co-chairman of the Loews Corporation, who runs its Loews Hotels unit, may have no choice.

His mother, Joan Tisch, lives in an apartment in the Loews Regency Hotel on Park Avenue in Manhattan, which she rents for $55,000 a month. (She also rents an additional hotel room for $4,200 a month.)

But starting this year, her rent will rise along with the inflation rate, according to Loews's proxy statement. Mrs. Tisch should be able to afford the increase: Last year, she sold $700 million of company stock.
